    GetAttachment(Int32, String)

    Finds an attachment by looking in the skin and skeletonData.defaultSkin using the slot index and attachment name.First the skin is checked and if the attachment was not found, the default skin is checked.

    GetBounds(out Single, out Single, out Single, out Single, ref Single[])

    Returns the axis aligned bounding box (AABB) of the region and mesh attachments for the current pose.

    Declaration
    public void GetBounds(out float x, out float y, out float width, out float height, ref float[] vertexBuffer)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Single x

    The horizontal distance between the skeleton origin and the left side of the AABB.
    Single y

    The vertical distance between the skeleton origin and the bottom side of the AABB.
    Single width

    The width of the AABB
    Single height

    The height of the AABB.
    Single[] vertexBuffer

    Reference to hold a float[]. May be a null reference. This method will assign it a new float[] with the appropriate size as needed.
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    SetAttachment(String, String)

    A convenience method to set an attachment by finding the slot with FindSlot, finding the attachment with GetAttachment, then setting the slot's slot.Attachment.

    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    String slotName
    String attachmentName

    May be null to clear the slot's attachment.

    SetBonesToSetupPose()

    public void SetBonesToSetupPose()
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    SetSkin(Skin)

    Sets the skin used to look up attachments before looking in the DefaultSkin. If the skin is changed, UpdateCache() is called.

    Attachments from the new skin are attached if the corresponding attachment from the old skin was attached. If there was no old skin, each slot's setup mode attachment is attached from the new skin.

    After changing the skin, the visible attachments can be reset to those attached in the setup pose by calling SetSlotsToSetupPose(). Also, often Apply(Skeleton) is called before the next time the skeleton is rendered to allow any attachment keys in the current animation(s) to hide or show attachments from the new skin.

    Declaration
    public void SetSkin(Skin newSkin)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Skin newSkin

    May be null.
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    UpdateCache()

    Caches information about bones and constraints. Must be called if the Skin is modified or if bones, constraints, or constraints, or weighted path attachments are added or removed.
